org.lantern.privacy
Class SecretServiceLocalCipherProvider

java.lang.Object
  org.lantern.privacy.AbstractAESLocalCipherProvider
      org.lantern.privacy.SecretServiceLocalCipherProvider
All Implemented Interfaces:
LocalCipherProvider
public class SecretServiceLocalCipherProvider
extends AbstractAESLocalCipherProvider

SecretServiceLocalCipherProvider This is a LocalCipherProvider that uses the DBUS "Secret Service" API to store a local key used to encrypt/decrypt local data.

Method Detail

secretServiceAvailable

public static boolean secretServiceAvailable()

requiresAdditionalUserInput

public boolean requiresAdditionalUserInput()
returns true if the cipher cannot function until additional user input is provided asynchronously. If a cipher is requested while this is true, an exception will be thrown.

Specified by:
requiresAdditionalUserInput in interface LocalCipherProvider

feedUserInput

public void feedUserInput(char[] input,
                          boolean init)
                   throws IOException,
                          GeneralSecurityException
feed in externally provided user input (eg password, phrase, etc) has no effect if requiresAdditionalUserInput() is false

Specified by:
feedUserInput in interface LocalCipherProvider
Parameters:
input - the user provided key data
init - if true, initialize the key with this input if false, validate the input against existing key data
Throws:
IOException
GeneralSecurityException

isInitialized

public boolean isInitialized()
Description copied from interface: LocalCipherProvider
returns true if the cipher has been initialized with key data and initial parameters. ie a password has been set or a key generated and initial parameters saved by successfully building at least one cipher.

Specified by:
isInitialized in interface LocalCipherProvider

reset

public void reset()
           throws IOException
resets cipher internally. Prior state information (initialization vectors, validators) will be destroyed. isInitialized will return false following this call.

Specified by:
reset in interface LocalCipherProvider
Throws:
IOException

hasLocalKey

protected boolean hasLocalKey()

newLocalCipher

public Cipher newLocalCipher(int opmode)
                      throws IOException,
                             GeneralSecurityException
Description copied from interface: LocalCipherProvider
Gives back a symmetric Cipher that can be used to encrypt/decrypt local data.

Specified by:
newLocalCipher in interface LocalCipherProvider
Parameters:
opmode - initalization mode, eg Cipher.ENCRYPT_MODE or Cipher.DECRYPT_MODE
Throws:
IOException
GeneralSecurityException
